definition: to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)

sentences.english: To tell you the truth , your father was right when he said that you undersold the company.
sentences.chinese: 老實告訴你，你父親對你低價拋售公司的判斷是對的。

sentences.english: Nordvig. 'Somebody new is selling now, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說，現在有新的投資者在拋售了。

sentences.english: But Suppiger said he believes the selloff was overdone.
sentences.chinese: 但Suppiger說他認爲拋售做的有點過了。

sentences.english: Of course you may hope to sell long before then.
sentences.chinese: 當然你或許不會等那麼久，提早出手拋售黃金。

sentences.english: On Thursday, the yen selloff gave other Asian currencies a breather.
sentences.chinese: 週四，日圓拋售潮讓亞洲其他貨幣鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: So, traders should consider sell into counter-trend bounces.
sentences.chinese: 因此交易者應考慮逢高拋售。

sentences.english: An emerging market crisis is likely to mark the end of the sell-off, in my view.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，新興市場的危機將標誌着拋售的結束。

sentences.english: Fast-money traders are selling as they are stopped out of short-term positions.
sentences.chinese: 投機者在拋售，是因爲他們正從短期頭寸脫身。

sentences.english: Heavy selling triggered Beijing's limit on how much yuan banks can officially buy from or sell back to the mainland.
sentences.chinese: 拋售達到了北京對銀行向內地買賣的人民幣額度限制。

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dipped more than 7 percent Thursday as panic sell-off dominated markets.
sentences.chinese: 道瓊斯工業指數週四跌幅超過7%，引發恐慌性拋售。

sentences.english: Other short term policy measures in Britain and New York tempered heavy selling.
sentences.chinese: 英國和紐約採取的短期政策措施降低了市場拋售浪潮。

sentences.english: With more supply in the market, there’s more incentive to sell.
sentences.chinese: 在市場供應加大的情況下，拋售動機就更加強烈。

sentences.english: As such we expect additional large sell-offs.
sentences.chinese: 我們預計會出現更大規模的拋售。

sentences.english: The stock market in great quantity undersells under the pressure, stops the rising trend.
sentences.chinese: 股市在巨量拋售壓力下，止住上升勢頭。

sentences.english: However, such investors are wont to sell into strength.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這些投資者習慣於逢高拋售。

sentences.english: But now, they actually have encountered deeply grieved underselling.
sentences.chinese: 但現在，它們卻遭遇了慘痛的拋售。

definition: hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
to convert (an asset) into cash/to cash out
to flee from danger/to avoid danger/to minimize risk/(finance) hedge
